metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29922 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
library/std/src/net/parser.rs in Rust before 1.53.0 does not properly consider extraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP address string, which (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass access control that is based on IP addresses, because of unexpected octal interpretation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.67 - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-all - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-clippy - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-gdb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-lldb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-src - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustc - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustfmt - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2').
